page.title: 03NORTH DERBY:WATER SUPPLY
page.content: THE RIVER DERWENT AND THE RESERVOIRS IN IS NORTHERN REACHES IS THE WATER SOURCE FOR THE AREA.THERE IS AN ABSTRACTION POINT NEAR LITTLE EATON WHENCE THE WATER IS PUMPED AFTER TREATMENT TO THE DRUM HILL SERVICE RESERVOIR. FROM HERE A COMPLEX UNDERGOUND MAINS NETWORK CARRIES POTABLE WATER AT PRESSURE TO THE SUBURBAN AREAS OF DERBY EG ALLESTREE. TO SERVE VILLAGES AND FARMS ON HIGH LAND OUTSIDE THE CITY BOUNDARY RESERVES OF WATER ARE MAINTAINED ON LOCAL HIGH POINTS EG QUARNDON WATER TOWER(CAPACITY 75,000 GALLONS) AND QUARNDON HILL RESERVOIR.THE AREA OF ALLESTREE QUARNDON AND LITTLE EATON CONSUMES ABOUT 25,000 GALLONS PER 24HRS.SEWAGE TREATMENT IS ADJACENT TO THE DERWENT AND MARKEATON BROOK.
